phq-9.title: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?
questions: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself — or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite — being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way

interpretation.recommendation: Your responses suggest you are experiencing minimal to no symptoms of depression. Keep monitoring your mood.
Your responses suggest you may be experiencing mild symptoms of depression. Consider talking to someone or exploring our resources.
Your responses suggest you may be experiencing moderate symptoms of depression. We strongly recommend talking to a counselor.
Your responses suggest you may be experiencing moderately severe symptoms of depression. Please book an appointment with a counselor as soon as possible.
Your responses suggest you may be experiencing severe symptoms of depression. It is very important that you speak with a mental health professional right away.

gad-7.title: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?
questions: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Worrying too much about different things
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

interpretation.recommendation: Your responses suggest you are experiencing minimal to no symptoms of anxiety.
Your responses suggest you may be experiencing mild symptoms of anxiety. Our resources on stress management may be helpful.
Your responses suggest you may be experiencing moderate symptoms of anxiety. Talking to a professional could provide you with effective coping strategies.
Your responses suggest you may be experiencing severe symptoms of anxiety. We strongly encourage you to book an appointment with a counselor to get support.
